column2: escapedpoet, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i just had to write a good review on this one cuz i saw so many bad ones... ive had many problems with birth control in the past.... i have extreme cramps... so much so that it basically makes me nonfunctional... i also experienced mood swings like you wouldnt believe and the pill i was on before  kelnor i actually got pregnant... but all of that decreased with kelnor... i usually take it remotely the same time every day but sometimes it does very and ive never experience any problems... i still do have cramps and mood swings but they certenly are not near as bad

column2: Amy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The only reason I did not give Kelnor a full 5 star review is because it is a pill you must take at the same time every day, and because I have experienced mood swings, depression, anxiety, headache/migraine and occasional spotting. I have not ruled out that it defiantly is or isn't the Kelnor causing these problems,  still just making connections. Otherwise this has worked great form me for two years! My periods are light and cramping is much better, acne has cleared up a lot too!

column2: Danny, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I missed one dose and within hours started experiencing symptoms, such as heavy bleeding, bloating, mood swings and increased appetite. I have never had these problems when using other oral pill contraceptive brands.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
diva40, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the fourth hormone since 12/08. This has been the most effective so far.

column2: moni_1103, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a question with the white tablets. has anyone skipped those all togther? a friend told me their sugar pills, just to keep you on track with taking your pills? Is this true or should i continue taking those?monica.crump@yahoo.com

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This birth control is cheaper than the others I was on, cleared up my skin! And shorter lighter periods as well. Only side effect might be that I put on 2 pounds. But I will take it!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was put on Kelnor by my doctor to treat my Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS) and to regulate my period. So far I've experienced some side effects, during the first few hours after taking the pill, but nothing that lasted for too long or anything too severe. I've noticed a change in my skin and mood, and sleeping has become more restful.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: it was effective, but it made me very sick and i had bad side effects with it. It caused more health problems than it prevented

column2: baf1107, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was switched to Kelnor after my other brand was discontinued. My periods are painless, light, and down to two days!

column2: Amanda29, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The dr. put me on kelnor to regulate my periods.
